results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
Why customers love Secfix

Secfix automates security compliance for SMBs in Europe. We help companies get and stay compliant with standards such as ISO 27001, GDPR, TISAX, and SOC 2 in weeks rather than months.

Companies nowadays need these standards to win enterprise deals. However, it is a manual, error-prone and tedious process that takes at least 1 year. Our platform integrates with the companies‚Äô tech stack (like GCP, AWS, Azure, Google Workspaces, Jira, Gitlab, etc.), extracts the data needed for compliance, and creates a checklist to become and remain certified. That way we can automate many processes and companies can save 100s of engineering hours working on documentation and excel sheets.

The fastest company finished their compliance in 4 weeks with us.

¬†

Why join Secfix

In August 2021 we raised a Pre-Seed round from top angel investors (including the first Flixbus investors Heinz Raufer, Rheinhard Wick, and Torsten Sturm) to build our Minimal Certifiable Product (MCP). We launched MCP in Nov 2021 with a few startups and scale-ups as early customers. The product pull was so strong that we got to the first 10 customers just within the first weeks. Now Secfix operates in Germany, Austria, Portugal, Spain, UK, and Poland and is a trusted partner of major audit firms (certification bodies).

We‚Äôve recently raised a bigger seed round from leading VCs and investors to expand our product to more security standards, more languages and with the goal to become the category leader in Europe!

¬†

What‚Äôs exciting about Secfix is our Company Values:

  • We are obsessed with our customers. We start with the customer and work backward to create products they want.

  • We build smart. We love working by YCombinator's principles and we preach those in our team.

  • We create trust. Transparency and ethics are within our DNA.

  • We are hacky. A functional basic prototype delivered in 2 weeks is worth more than the perfect solution delivered in 2 months.

  • We take ownership. Building a startup is about ownership and being accountable for¬† timely delivery.

  • We are leaders of the remote. We are passionately building a culture where people can be productive working from anywhere.

¬†

About the role:

We're looking for a hungry and hard-working Chief of Staff to help us solve a wide variety of problems across the business and build culture. Any problem that our founding team faces becomes your problem. You'll get first-hand exposure to what it means to build and scale a startup.

¬†

Preferred experience and behaviours¬†

  • You take pride in delivering great outcomes.

  • You love speed. You have 4+ years of work experience in a fast-paced startup environment, scale-up, consultancy, VC, or complex larger technology organisation, ideally within an operational or people growth capacity.¬†

  • Past founder experience or close collaboration with founders is highly advantageous.¬†

  • You have experience in working and improving remote collaboration in the team.

  • You're passionate: you take pride in your work and how it can impact the mission we‚Äôre on.¬†

  • You are reliable & smart. You take pride in getting things done on time and have a clear, concise communication style. Using pragmatism, you help the founding team to make better decisions.

  • You‚Äôre a passionate entrepreneur with the ability to be hacky where needed to keep momentum.¬†

  • You are data-driven, analytical and have strong attention to detail.

  • You love automation, baking it into process wherever possible. Experience with Zapier is advantageous.

  • We believe in and appreciate radical candour, it forces us to be better!

  • You are a natural project manager. You can drive the future of the company with a growth mindset and creative pragmatism

  • You are creative and curious about new technologies and advancements.

  • You need to be able to work or learn fast to work with many modern tools like Zapier, Loom, Gather, Notion, Slack, etc. Knowledge of coding is a plus!

¬†

Responsibilities:

  • You‚Äôll wear multiple hats as a generalist, supporting the founders with day-to-day operations and leading impactful projects from hiring, people ops, business development, marketing, etc.

  • You‚Äôll be Head of Remote: We are a 100% remote company, which means we have to be creative in building a great culture. You‚Äôll help build and maintain our remote culture and support handbooks and processes. We love events so helping to organise virtual events, on-site and in cool locations. Gitlab is our inspiration.

  • You‚Äôll help design our recruitment operations and processes in collaboration with the founders.

  • Coordinating with the designers and the technology team, you‚Äôll help to deliver new features on our product roadmap

  • Work with the founders to influence design of the sales process and automation processes with Zapier, Linkedin Navigator, Apollo and new tools.

  • You‚Äôll take ownership of ad-hoc projects such as financial modelling, KPI planning, event organisation, compliance, creating fundraising decks, etc.

  • You‚Äôll play an interim owner role for different areas of the business, helping understand who we need to bring to take those areas forward.

  • Working with different business units, you'll find new ways to implement solutions to save time or cut costs. This includes the design and constant optimisation of internal structures and processes

Logistics: Remote UK-based role. The team is distributed across Germany and Europe.¬†¬†

¬†

What you can expect from Secfix:

  • We are backed by top VCs and accelerators. You can get direct access to world-class mentors.

  • Industry-Competitive base salary and generous equity package

  • Latest tech equipment. (MacBook, monitors, headphones)

  • Health insurance

  • Remote Workspace Stipend

  • Flexible Work Hours and Location

  • 26 vacation days

  • 100% remote work in Gather

  • Virtual Team Building Activities, Lunch and Learns, and other Company-Wide Events

  • Personal Development Budget of 1,000 EUR which includes headspace membership for mental health, gym membership and virtual team building

  • Have more ideas for perks? You can make them reality at Secfix üôÇ

¬†

Interview Process:

  • 30 min - Screen/intro call with Amy - our lovely people person

  • 30 min - Chat with our Co-founder

  • 1h - Final interview with team & Co-Founder

results.title: Chief of Staff, OpenSSF
results.description:
Company Description

The Linux Foundation is the organization of choice for the world's top developers and companies to build ecosystems that accelerate open technology development and commercial adoption. Together with the worldwide open source community, it is solving the hardest technology problems by creating the largest shared technology investment in history.

Today, the Linux Foundation has over 2,000 corporate members from over 41 countries, including every single one the Fortune 100. The Linux Foundation has proudly created over $54B in shared technology value since inception.



Job Description

OpenSSF‚Äôs mission is to advance open source security for all by working collaboratively with upstream and existing communities. Our projects and initiatives are focused on securing the open source supply chain and promoting secure development best practices for everyone. We use our Technical Vision and our Values to guide discussion, decision making, and delivery for all our programs.

We are seeking a Chief of Staff to help us execute on our purpose alongside our member organizations, working groups and community leaders. You‚Äôll work side-by-side with these stakeholders, as well as the program management team and other Linux Foundation teams to meaningfully and measurably execute on goals, and cultivate new and existing relationships to their fullest potential. Most importantly, you‚Äôll work closely with the General Manager, to whom you will report.

Salary Range: $175k-$300k

¬†

Job Role And Responsibilities

As part of the OpenSSF leadership team, you‚Äôll work with staff, governing board members, and the larger OpenSSF community to map the priorities and goals of the foundation to an effective deployment of the financial and talent contributions. Your work will drive improved communication and efficiency across the organization‚Äôs many working groups, projects, member organizations, and strategic partnerships.

‚ÄØKey responsibilities include:

  • Collaborating with the General Manager, Governing Board members, and other stakeholders to determine, document, and prioritize business strategies

  • Acting as a thought partner to the GM for new ideas and initiatives.

  • Managing the organization‚Äôs schedule of events, important deadlines, and significant project timelines

  • Leading the OKR development process for the organization and determining key performance indicators and how to measure performance

  • Working with teammates to deliver, monitor and communicate progress towards goals

  • Overseeing strategic initiatives from ideation to implementation

  • Identifying and helping solve core problems or opportunities within established processes, and providing feedback to optimize community processes

  • Providing support and oversight for special projects and initiatives

  • Planning, coordinating and leading staff meetings and workshops

  • Identifying and providing recommendations on process improvements across the organization

  • Work with OpenSSF staff and community members to summarize and report out on the activities and impact of the organization in a way suitable for both internal and external audiences.

  • Responding to inquiries on behalf of the General Manager, assisting them to maintain open lines of communication with current and potential member organizations and strategic partners

  • Make occasional public presentations on the goals, activities, and impact of the project.¬†



Qualifications

Required Skills

  • Strong oral and written communication skills: you write down action items, follow up with meeting notes, and have a penchant for documenting process and goals

  • Strong cooperative leadership skills: you understand the nuances required when working with volunteers, and that our mandate is to serve

  • Strong problem solving skills: you aren‚Äôt afraid of a little ambiguity, a hard problem, or a sticky situation and work productively to resolve issues

  • Operational focus: you plan, coordinate, get sign off, prep documents and set agendas to help keep everyone in alignment.¬†

  • Demonstrated ability to understand, operate, and clearly communicate in a complex, multi-stakeholder environment.

  • Experience working with open source communities: you understand the open source ecosystem and the challenges and opportunities it faces



Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

The Linux Foundation is creating the greatest shared technology investment in history by enabling open source collaboration across companies, developers, and users. We are the organization of choice to build ecosystems that accelerate open technology development and commercial adoption.

The Linux Foundation is an all-remote workforce that hires world-class talent.¬† We are as passionate about providing a flexible and supportive work culture as we are about open-source software. Collaboration is in our DNA, and we pride ourselves on being able to work closely together while not being tied to an office. We offer exceptional benefits - e.g., top of the line healthcare plans, unlimited PTO, and 100% 401k match up to the IRS-defined limit per year.

The Linux Foundation is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

results.title: Business Analyst
results.description:
Mind Computing is seeking a Sr. Business Analyst to join our growing team in support of the Department of Veteran Affairs, specifically the Financial Services Center (FSC). The FSC serves customers internally at the VA and other government agencies (OGA).

The candidate must reside within the continental US.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide expertise in change management and training support.
  • Provide organizational and strategic planning for a wide variety of technical and functional environments.
  • Provide expertise in the following areas, including but not limited to, Configuration Management, Strategic
    Planning, Knowledge Management, Business Analysis, and Technical Analysis.
